thread.title: Local sports briefs: K-State athletics phasing out student privilege fees
thread.title_full: Local sports briefs: K-State athletics phasing out student privilege fees

author: From Staff and Wire Reports
title: Local sports briefs: K-State athletics phasing out student privilege fees
text:
Local sports briefs: K-State athletics phasing out student privilege fees Posted: October 16, 2015 - 10:09pm From Staff and Wire Reports 
K-STATE ATHLETICS TO PHASE OUT STUDENT PRIVILEGE FEES: The Kansas State athletics department, in conjunction with the Student Government Association, announced Friday it will phase out the annual receipt of student privilege fees. 
The K-State Student Senate approved the legislation that will reduce allocations to athletics to $450,000 in fiscal year 2017, $350,000 in 2018 and $200,000 in 2019 with the anticipation that the allocations will then cease. Currently, students fees have an allocation of $500,695 which is used in part to defray a portion of the $1.1 million in salaries for student workers at athletic events. 
KU’S DIALLO NAMED TO ABDUL-JABBAR AWARD WATCH LIST: Kansas freshman Cheick Diallo was named to the Kareem Abdul-Jabbar Center of the Year award watch list, joining 19 other players from across the country. 
Diallo, a 6-foot-9, 220-pound native of Mali, Africa, joins four teammates on preseason watch lists: Perry Ellis (Karl Malone Award), Wayne Selden and Svi Mykhailiuk (Julius Erving Award) and Frank Mason (Bob Cousy Award). 
K-STATE VOLLEYBALL SWEEPS OU: The Kansas State volleyball team swept past Oklahoma 25-16, 25-21, 25-19 on Friday in Norman, Okla. Brooke Sassin and Bryna Vogel led the Wildcats (11-7, 3-3 Big 12) with 11 kills apiece. 
KANSAS SOCCER CLOBBERED BY WEST VIRGINIA: West Virginia clobbered the Kansas soccer team 6-0 on Friday in Morgantown, W.Va. Kailey Utley got the Mountaineers on the board with a goal four minutes into the contest, ending the Jayhawks’ (8-6-1, 3-2-0 Big 12) 307-minute opponent scoreless streak. 
WU VOLLEYBALL CONTINUES MIAA ROLL: The Washburn volleyball team swept aside Northwest Missouri State 25-17, 25-21, 25-23 on Friday in at Lee Arena. Leanna Willer led the Ichabods (19-2, 7-2 MIAA) with 12 kills.
